item.title: [Paper] Better Testing, Worse Quality?
item.description: Better Testing, Worse Quality? Elisabeth Hendrickson tells a story inspired by her own experience as a Quality Assurance manager showing how the downstream effects of organizational structure can lead to the exact opposite of the desired outcomes.
item.content:encoded:
Better Testing, Worse Quality?

Elisabeth Hendrickson tells a story inspired by her own experience as a Quality Assurance manager showing how the downstream effects of organizational structure can lead to the exact opposite of the desired outcomes.

item.title: [Paper] Nobody Ever Gets Credit for Fixing Problems that Never Happened: Creating and Sustaining Process Improvement
item.description: Nobody Ever Gets Credit for Fixing Problems that Never Happened: Creating and Sustaining Process Improvement A deep look into the common pitfalls of trying to work harder instead of work smarter.
item.content:encoded:
Nobody Ever Gets Credit for Fixing Problems that Never Happened: Creating and Sustaining Process Improvement

A deep look into the common pitfalls of trying to work harder instead of work smarter.
